newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: GCC chief briefs Bahrain emir on Gulf Arab summit.
newsitem.headline: GCC chief briefs Bahrain emir on Gulf Arab summit.

text.p: The secretary-general of the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) on Monday briefed Bahrain's emir on the outcome of a Gulf Arab summit in Doha this month which Manama boycotted because of a border and espionage row with Qatar.

Jameel Hujilan briefed Sheikh Isa bin Sulman al-Khalifa and Foreign Minister Sheikh Mohammad bin Mubarak al-Khalifa on the summit's decision to set up a committee on the decades-long Bahrain-Qatar border row, Bahrain's official Gulf News Agency (GNA) said.
Sheikh Isa renewed Bahrain's support for the GCC, it added.
It was Hujilan's first visit to Bahrain since leaders of Saudi Arabia, Qatar, United Arab Emirates, Oman and Kuwait ended the annual GCC summit on December 9.
Bahrain, locked in a dispute with Qatar over small islands in the Gulf controlled by Bahrain, has put two Qataris on trial for spying.
